content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 11 to node 3 is:


```
11->12->13->3
```
In the provided graph, node 11 has a path of length 3 to node 12, then node 12 has a path of length 2 to node 13, and finally node 13 has a path of length 0 to node 3. Therefore, the shortest path from node 11 to node 3 is:

11 -> 12 -> 13 -> 3

Note that this shortest path does not include node 14, which was not part of the path from node 11 to node 3.

The shortest path from node 11 to node 13 is:


```
11->12->13
```
In the provided graph, node 11 has a path of length 2 to node 12, and then node 12 has a path of length 1 to node 13. Therefore, the shortest path from node 11 to node 13 is:

11 -> 12 -> 13

Note that this shortest path does not include any other nodes, as it only goes directly from node 11 to node 13.
